title: nCoV-2019 sequencing protocol (single sample)

source.description:
Mix the following components in an 0.2mL 8-strip tube;
Component Volume
50µM random hexamers
10mM dNTPs mix (10mM each)
Template RNA
Total

source.body: Viral RNA input from a clinical sample should be between Ct 18-35. If Ct is between 12-15, then dilute the sample 100-fold in water, if between 15-18 then dilute 10-fold in water. This will reduce the likelihood of PCR-inhibition.
A mastermix should be made up in the mastermix cabinet and aliquoted into PCR strip tubes. Tubes should be wiped down when entering and leaving the mastermix cabinet.

source.description: Gently mix by pipetting and pulse spin the tube to collect liquid at the bottom of the tube.

Component Volume

source.body: A mastermix should be made up in the mastermix cabinet and added to the denatured RNA in the extraction and sample addition cabinet. Tubes should be wiped down when entering and leaving the mastermix cabinet.

source.description: Gently mix by pipetting and pulse spin the tube to collect liquid at the bottom of the tube.

Hold at
If required resuspend lyophilised primers at a concentration of 100µM each

source.body: nCov-2019/V2 primers for this protocol were designed using Primal Scheme and generate overlapping 400nt amplicons. Primer names and pools are listed in the .TSV file.

source.description:
Generate primer pool stocks by adding
of each primer pair to a
Eppendorf labelled either “Pool 1 (100µM)” or “Pool 2 (100µM)”. Total volume should be
for Pool 1 (100µM) and
for Pool 2 (100µM). These are your 100µM stocks of each primer pool.

source.body: Primers should be diluted and pooled in the mastermix cabinet which should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.

source.description: Dilute this primer pool 1:10 in molecular grade water, to generate 10µM primer stocks. It is recommend that multiple aliquots of each primer pool are made to in case of degradation or contamination.

source.body: Primers need to be used at a final concentration of 0.015µM per primer. In this case both pools have 98 primers in so the requirement is 3.6µL primer pools (10uM) per 25µL reaction. For other schemes, adjust the volume added appropriately.

source.description:
In the mastermix hood set up the multiplex PCR reactions as follows in 0.2mL 8-strip PCR tubes:
Component Pool 1 Pool 2
5X Q5 Reaction Buffer
10 mM dNTPs
Q5 Hot Start DNA Polymerase
Primer Pool 1 or 2 (10µM)
Nuclease-free water
Total

source.body: A PCR mastermix for each pool should be made up in the mastermix cabinet and aliquoted into PCR strip tubes. Tubes should be wiped down when entering and leaving the mastermix cabinet.

source.description:
In the extraction and sample addition cabinet add
cDNA to each tube and mix well by pipetting.

source.body: The extraction and sample addition cabinet should should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.

source.description: Pulse centrifuge the tubes to collect the contents at the bottom of the tube.

source.body: Cycle number should be 25 for Ct 18-21 up to a maximum of 35 cycles for Ct 35

source.body: This is a ‘one-pot ligation’ protocol for native barcoded ligation libraries. We have seen no reduction in performance compared to standard libraries, and is made faster by using the Ultra II® ligation module which is compatible with the Ultra II® end repair/dA-tailing module removing a clean-up step.

source.body: Input to the one-pot native barcoding reaction will vary depending on the amplicon length but we have determined 5ng is the correct input for efficient barcoding of this amplicon length. Process at least 7 samples plus one negative control per native barcoded library in order to have sufficient material at the end.
